an7.35:1: "Last night, bhikkhus, when the night had advanced, a certain deity of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Jeta's Grove, approached me, paid homage to me, stood to one side, and said to me: ‘Bhante, there are these seven qualities that lead to the non-decline of a bhikkhu. What seven? Reverence for the Teacher, reverence for the Dhamma, reverence for the Saṅgha, reverence for the training, reverence for concentration, being easy to correct, and good friendship. These seven qualities lead to the non-decline of a bhikkhu.’ This is what that deity said. Then the deity paid homage to me, circumambulated me keeping the right side toward me, and disappeared right there."
an7.35:2: When this was said, the Venerable Sāriputta said to the Blessed One:
an7.35:3: The Blessed One said:"Good, good, Sāriputta! It is good that you understand in detail the meaning of this statement that I have spoken in brief in such a way."The Buddha here repeats the whole statement of Sāriputta, ending:
